item.title: Pinocchio
item.description:
Shot in stunning Italian locations, Matteo Garrone’s rich world of mystery and wonder stars Academy Award® winning actor Roberto Benigni as Geppetto, the old woodcarver whose puppet creation, Pinocchio, magically comes to life with dreams of becoming a real boy. Easily led astray, Pinocchio (nine-year-old Federico Ielapi) tumbles from one misadventure to another as he is tricked, kidnapped and chased by bandits through a wonderful world full of imaginative creatures – from the belly of a giant fish, to the Land Of Toys and the Field Of Miracles.

Rated: Not Rated

Release Date: Dec 25, 2020

item.title: Hillbilly Elegy
item.description:
J.D. Vance (Gabriel Basso), a former Marine from southern Ohio and current Yale Law student, is on the verge of landing his dream job when a family crisis forces him to return to the home he’s tried to forget. J.D. must navigate the complex dynamics of his Appalachian family, including his volatile relationship with his mother Bev (Amy Adams), who’s struggling with addiction. Fueled by memories of his grandmother Mamaw (Glenn Close), the resilient and whip-smart woman who raised him, J.D. comes to embrace his family’s indelible imprint on his own personal journey. [Netflix]

Rated: R

Release Date: Nov 11, 2020

item.title: The Nest
item.description:
Rory (Jude Law), an ambitious entrepreneur and former commodities broker, persuades his American wife, Allison (Carrie Coon), and their children to leave the comforts of suburban America and return to his native England during the 1980s. Sensing opportunity, Rory rejoins his former firm and leases a centuries-old country manor, with grounds for Allison’s horses and plans to build a stable. Soon the promise of a lucrative new beginning starts to unravel, the couple have to face the unwelcome truths lying beneath the surface of their marriage.

Rated: R

Release Date: Sep 18, 2020

item.title: Wonder Woman 1984
item.description:
Fast forward to the 1980s as Wonder Woman’s next big screen adventure finds her facing two all-new foes: Max Lord and The Cheetah.

Rated: PG-13

Release Date: Dec 25, 2020

item.title: The Midnight Sky
item.description:
Augustine (George Clooney), a lonely scientist in the Arctic, races to stop Sully (Felicity Jones) and her fellow astronauts from returning home to a mysterious global catastrophe.

Rated: PG-13

Release Date: Dec 11, 2020

item.title: Sylvie's Love
item.description:
In Sylvie’s Love, the jazz is smooth and the air sultry in the hot New York summer of 1957. Robert (Nnamdi Asomugha), a saxophonist, spends late nights playing behind a less-talented but well-known bandleader, as member of a jazz quartet. Sylvie (Tessa Thompson), who dreams of a career in television, spends her summer days helping around her father’s record store, as she waits for her fiancé to return from war. When Robert takes a part-time job at the record store, the two begin a friendship that sparks a deep passion in each of them unlike anything they have felt before. As the summer winds down, life takes them in different directions, bringing their relationship to an end. Years pass, Sylvie’s career as a TV producer blossoms, while Robert has to come to terms with what the age of Motown is doing to the popularity of Jazz. In a chance meeting, Sylvie and Robert cross paths again, only to find that while their lives have changed, their feelings for each other remain the same.

Rated: M

Release Date: Dec 23, 2020

item.title: Promising Young Woman
item.description:
Everyone said Cassie (Carey Mulligan) was a promising young woman... until a mysterious event abruptly derailed her future. But nothing in Cassie’s life is what it appears to be: she’s wickedly smart, tantalizingly cunning, and she’s living a secret double life by night. Now, an unexpected encounter is about to give Cassie a chance to right the wrongs of the past.

Rated: R

Release Date: Dec 25, 2020

item.title: Soul
item.description:
Joe Gardner is a middle-school band teacher who gets the chance of a lifetime to play at the best jazz club in town. But one small misstep takes him from the streets of New York City to The Great Before – a fantastical place where new souls get their personalities, quirks and interests before they go to Earth. Determined to return to his life, Joe teams up with a precocious soul, 22, who has never understood the appeal of the human experience. As Joe desperately tries to show 22 what’s great about living, he may just discover the answers to some of life’s most important questions.

Rated: PG

Release Date: Dec 25, 2020

item.title: Small Axe: Education
item.description:
Education is the coming of age story of 12-year-old Kingsley (Kenyah Sandy), who has a fascination for astronauts and rockets. When Kingsley is pulled to the headmaster's office for being disruptive in class, he discovers he's being sent to a school for those with "special needs." Distracted by working two jobs, his parents (Sharlene Whyte, Daniel Francis) are unaware of the unofficial segregation policy at play, preventing many Black children from receiving the education they deserve, until a group of West Indian women take matters into their own hands.

Release Date: Dec 18, 2020

item.title: Audrey
item.description:
Audrey Hepburn won her first Academy Award at the age of 24, and went on to become one of the world’s greatest cultural icons: a once-in-a-generation beauty, and legendary star of Hollywood’s Golden Age, whose style and pioneering collaboration with Hubert de Givenchy continues to inspire. But who was the real Audrey Hepburn? Malnourished as a child, abandoned by her father, and growing up under Nazi occupation in Holland, Hepburn faced a life-long battle with the traumas of her past, which thwarted her dreams of becoming a ballet dancer, and cast a shadow over her personal life. Yet she found inner peace, using her superstardom for good as a global ambassador for UNICEF, and bringing her life full circle: first a victim of war, then a source of relief to millions. A hybrid of rare archive, cinematic dance sequences, and intimate interviews with those who knew her best, this film brings a truly extraordinary woman to life, who stands as testament to the power of love and forgiveness.

Rated: Not Rated

Release Date: Dec 15, 2020

item.title: Museum Town
item.description:
Museum Town tells the story of a unique museum, the small town it calls home, and the great risk, hope, and power of art to transform a desolate post-industrial city.

Rated: Not Rated

Release Date: Dec 18, 2020

item.title: Fisherman's Friends
item.description:
A fast living, cynical London music executive (Daniel Mays) heads to a remote Cornish village on a stag weekend where he's pranked by his boss (Noel Clarke) into trying to sign a group of shanty singing fishermen (led by James Purefoy). He becomes the ultimate "fish out of water" as he struggles to gain the respect or enthusiasm of the unlikely boy band and their families (including Tuppence Middleton) who value friendship and community over fame and fortune. As he's drawn deeper into the traditional way of life he's forced to reevaluate his own integrity and ultimately question what success really means.

Rated: Not Rated

Release Date: Jul 24, 2020

item.title: News of the World
item.description:
Five years after the end of the Civil War, Captain Jefferson Kyle Kidd (Tom Hanks), a veteran of three wars, now moves from town to town as a non-fiction storyteller, sharing the news of presidents and queens, glorious feuds, devastating catastrophes, and gripping adventures from the far reaches of the globe. In the plains of Texas, he crosses paths with Johanna (Helena Zengel), a 10-year-old taken in by the Kiowa people six years earlier and raised as one of their own. Johanna, hostile to a world she’s never experienced, is being returned to her biological aunt and uncle against her will. Kidd agrees to deliver the child where the law says she belongs. As they travel hundreds of miles into the unforgiving wilderness, the two will face tremendous challenges of both human and natural forces as they search for a place that either can call home.

Rated: PG-13

Release Date: Dec 25, 2020

item.title: David Byrneâ??s American Utopia
item.description:
David Byrne’s American Utopia brings the critically acclaimed Broadway show to HBO in a one-of-a-kind film directed by Spike Lee. Recorded during its run at Broadway’s Hudson Theatre in New York City, David Byrne is joined by an ensemble of 11 musicians, singers, and dancers from around the globe, inviting audiences into a joyous dreamworld where human connection, self-evolution, and social justice are paramount.

Rated: Not Rated

Release Date: Oct 17, 2020

item.title: Farewell Amor
item.description:
After 17 years in exile, Walter finally reunites with his family after being forced to leave Angola for New York City. We meet the family as Walter is picking up his wife, Esther, and daughter, Sylvia, from the airport to bring them home to his one-bedroom Brooklyn apartment. They quickly discover how the years of separation have turned them into absolute strangers. As they attempt to overcome the personal and political hurdles amongst them, they rely on the muscle memory of dance to find their way back “home.”

Rated: NR

Release Date: Dec 11, 2020

item.title: Nomadland
item.description:
Following the economic collapse of a company town in rural Nevada, Fern (Frances McDormand) packs her van and sets off on the road exploring a life outside of conventional society as a modern-day nomad.

Rated: R

Release Date: Dec 04, 2020

item.title: I'm Your Woman
item.description:
In this 1970s set crime drama, a woman is forced to go on the run after her husband betrays his partners, sending her and her baby on a dangerous journey.

Rated: R

Release Date: Dec 04, 2020

item.title: The Forty-Year-Old Version
item.description:
Radha, a down-on-her-luck NY playwright, is desperate for a breakthrough before 40. But when she foils what seems like her last shot at success, she’s left with no choice but to reinvent herself as rapper RadhaMUSPrime. The Forty-Year-Old Version follows Radha as she vacillates between the worlds of Hip Hop and theater on a quest to find her true voice.

Rated: R

Release Date: Oct 02, 2020

item.title: To the Ends of the Earth
item.description:
Yoko (Atsuko Maeda) travels with a small crew to Uzbekistan to shoot an episode of her travel reality show. In front of the camera, her persona is carefree and happy-go-lucky, but behind the scenes she is cautious and introverted. Despite her best efforts, the filming of the television series ends unsuccessfully, and frustrated by the failure, she sets off into the mysterious country. Lost in the streets of Tashkent, she finds herself adrift and alone, confronting her deepest fears and hidden aspirations. [KimStim]

Rated: Not Rated

Release Date: Dec 11, 2020

item.title: Hunter Hunter
item.description:
Hunter Hunter follows a family living in the remote wilderness earning a living as fur trappers. Joseph Mersault (Devon Sawa), his wife Anne (Camille Sullivan), and their daughter Rene?e (Summer H. Howell) struggle to make ends meet and think their traps are being hunted by the return of a rogue wolf. Determined to catch the predator in the act, Joseph leaves his family behind to track the wolf. Anne and Rene?e grow increasingly anxious during Joseph’s prolonged absence and struggle to survive without him. When they hear a strange noise outside their cabin, Anne hopes it is Joseph but instead finds a man named Lou (Nick Stahl), who has been severely injured and left for dead. The longer Lou stays and Joseph is away, the more paranoid Anne becomes, and the idea of a mysterious predator in the woods slowly becomes a threat much closer to home.

Rated: NR

Release Date: Dec 18, 2020

item.title: James Bond Expert Rules Out Henry Cavill as Daniel Craig's 007 Replacement
item.description: Dr. Ian Kinane has stated that Henry Cavill is simply 'too famous' to take over the role from Daniel Craig following No Time to Die.

item.title: Hawkeye Star Hailee Steinfeld Shares First Thoughts on Becoming Marvel's Kate Bishop

item.title: The Mandalorian Fans Want Pedro Pascal as Gomez in Tim Burton's Addams Family TV Reboot
item.description: Pedro Pascal is quickly becoming another frontrunner with fans for the part of Gomez Addams in Tim Burton's The Addams Family.

item.title: Keep Calling Him Baby Yoda, But the Child Prefers Grogu Says The Mandalorian Creator
item.description: Grogu might not be able to ever shake his Baby Yoda nickname as even The Mandalorian creator Jon Favreau still uses it.

item.title: Wonder Woman 1984 Is Only Opening in 40% of U.S. Movie Theaters This Christmas Weekend
item.description: Warner Bros. is releasing Wonder Woman 1984 in theaters and on HBO Max this weekend.

item.description: Hugh Jackman couldn't wait to tell Ryan Reynolds the results after learning that he'd won the charity contest between them.

item.title: James Bond Home MGM Is Exploring Studio Sale Valued at $5.5B
item.description: MGM Holdings is reportedly looking at sale options due to the shift to streaming.

item.title: Wonder Woman 3 May Lose Patty Jenkins Following HBO Max Streaming Decision
item.description: Wonder Woman 1984 director Patty Jenkins is not particularly interested in returning for a third adventure if it receives the same streaming release.

item.title: Patrick Dempsey Returns for Disenchanted Disney+ Sequel
item.description: Both Patrick Dempsey's Robert Phillip, and his daughter Morgan, will be back for more Disney adventures in the Enchanted sequel.

item.title: She-Hulk Is the MCU's First Sitcom, Will Be a Half-Hour Legal Comedy
item.description: Marvel's Kevin Feige has offered a few insights regarding the Disney+ series, She-Hulk, describing it as a 'half-hour legal comedy.'

item.title: Ralph Macchio Compares Daniel & Johnny Relationship to Ross & Rachel in Cobra Kai Season 3
item.description: Ralph Macchio believes Cobra Kai will see Daniel and Johnny become friends one day, but maybe not quite yet.

item.title: The Exorcist Sequel Is Happening at Blumhouse with Halloween Director David Gordon Green
item.description: Blumhouse is making a true sequel to The Exorcist with Halloween Director David Gordon Green.

item.title: Mads Mikkelsen Never Consulted Johnny Depp About Taking Over Fantastic Beasts 3 Role
item.description: Mads Mikkelsen has not consulted Johnny Depp about playing Grindelwald in Fantastic Beasts 3 yet.

item.title: How Gal Gadot's Wonder Woman Audition with Ben Affleck Instantly Won Her the Part

item.title: First Coming 2 America Footage Has Fans Excited for the Return of Sexual Chocolate
item.description: Eddie Murphy is back as Sexual Chocolate singer Randy Watson in Coming 2 America, and fans are absolutely ecstatic.

item.description: The Oscar winning trio of Denzel Washington, Rami Malek and Jared Leto are butting heads in crime thriller The Little Things.

item.description: Gal Gadot returns to battle a greedy tycoon and jealous rival in Patty Jenkin's retro sequel Wonder Woman 1984, in theaters and HBO Max on Christmas Day.

item.title: Coming 2 America Trailer Has Arrived, Eddie Murphy Returns on Amazon Prime
item.description: The first trailer for Coming 2 America is here and teases a welcome follow-up all these years later.

item.title: Netflix's The Gray Man Filming Delayed Due to Rising Covid Cases in California
item.description: Due to a rise in cases in California, production on Netflix's big budget thriller The Gray Man has been delayed.

item.title: Gal Gadot Thinks Wonder Woman 3 Needs to Move Out of the Past and Into the Present
item.description: While we await the imminent release of Wonder Woman 1984, Gal Gadot has revealed what she hopes to see in a potential third movie.

item.title: Joker's Heroic Turn in Justice League HBO Max Miniseries Teased by Zack Snyder
item.description: Zack Snyder has revealed some details regarding Jared Leto's 'road weary' return as Joker in The Snyder Cut, and may continue the story in a comic book spin-off.

item.title: Luke Wilson Knows as Much as You Do About Legally Blonde 3
item.description: Legally Blonde star Luke Wilson has no idea whether he'll be back for the upcoming threequel.

item.title: The Mandalorian Season 2 Finale Makes Vintage Star Wars Toy Accessory Canon
item.description: Jon Favreau and Dave Filoni have a deep love for the Star Wars franchise, which finds them placing some pretty rare Easter Eggs for fans to find.

item.title: Coming 2 America Poster Brings Eddie Murphy's King Akeem Back to New York
item.description: A new poster teases Eddie Murphy's return as Prince Akeem Joffer in long-awaited sequel Coming 2 America.

item.title: Illegal Streaming Could Become a Felony Under New COVID-19 Stimulus Bill
item.description: The entertainment industry is getting $15 billion from Congress, which adds in new copyright laws.

item.description: Shang-Chi and the Legend of the Ten Rings star Simu Liu has signed to star alongside Mark Wahlberg in Arthur the King.

item.title: The Book of Boba Fett Is Filming Before The Mandalorian Season 3
item.description: Jon Favreau confirms that The Mandalorian season 3 will begin filming next year with pre-production underway.

item.title: Ready Player Two Movie Is in Early Development Confirms Author Ernest Cline
item.description: Ready Player Two author Ernest Cline has revealed that a big screen adaptation is in early development.

item.title: The Book of Boba Fett Is Not The Mandalorian Season 3
item.description: Jon Favreau has confirmed that The Book of Boba Fett is filming now, with The Mandalorian season 3 set to begin in 2021.

item.title: Sing 2 Brings in Bono, Halsey and Pharrell as First Poster Is Unveiled
item.description: Several musicians, including U2 icon Bono, have joined the cast of upcoming animated sequel Sing 2.

item.title: Karate Kid 2 Star Reveals Secrets Behind Chozen's Return in Cobra Kai Season 3
item.description: Yuji Okumoto, who will reprise the role of Chozen in Cobra Kai season 3, discusses the characters growth, and fighting with Ralph Macchio.

item.title: Elliot Page Thanks Supportive Fans Following Transgender Announcement
item.description: Elliot Page has released his first real selfie after coming out as transgender back at the beginning of December.

item.title: Jon Favreau Breaks His Silence on the Shocking Season Finale of The Mandalorian
item.description: The Mandalorian season 2 has come to an end and Jon Favreau is amazed that they were able to keep their finale secret under wraps for over a year.

item.title: The Book of Boba Fett Logo and Disney+ Series Details Revealed
item.description: Lucasfilm is bringing back the legendary bounty hunter in The Book of Boba Fett on Disney Plus in December 2021.

item.title: The Mandalorian Season 2 Finale Post-Credits Scene Explained
item.description: The post-credits scene has set off many speculations about Boba Fett's future role in the Star Wars' universe.

item.description: Netflix has released the first footage from Charlie Brooker and Annabel Jones' upcoming 2020 mockumentary.

item.description: Kindergarten Cop hit theaters 30 years ago and some of the young cast members got back together via Zoom to discuss the making of the family comedy.

item.title: Gisele's Return in Fast & Furious Franchise Is Not on Gal Gadot's To-Do List
item.description: Gal Gadot reveals whether she will return to the Fast And Furious franchise as Gisele.
